bug.author: silpian
bug.summary: Possible Error in "TensorFlow For Poets" Guide
bug.description: Small, possible error found in <denchmark-link:https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/#4>https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/#4</denchmark-link> : "The first figure shows accuracy (x-axis) as a function of training progress (y-axis):" Should be corrected to: "The first figure shows accuracy (y-axis) as a function of training progress (x-axis):" Or you can change the "accuracy_1" graph below it.

comments.comment: Thanks, assigning to Wolff who added the codelab.

np, thank you for the confirmation email <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On May 29, 2018 at 12:49 PM, <Ayush Dubey ***@***.***)> wrote:
Thanks, assigning to Wolff who added the codelab.
— You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub (#19630 (comment)), or mute the thread (https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AY6WJX57Ki7C2kaa-aBhitxtXwWC5ggnks5t3YorgaJpZM4UR46T).

Cool, np. There are also some minor spelling errors on <denchmark-link:https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/#5>https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/tensorflow-for-poets/#5</denchmark-link> (in the yellow box):
"WIf you chose a mobilenet that takes a smaller input size, then be shure to set the --input_size flag using the shell variable you set earlier."
should probably be:
"**If** you chose a mobilenet that takes a smaller input size, then be to **sure** set the --input_size flag using the shell variable you set earlier."
But people can probably understand it regardless. Thank you. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
